text: @mwotton If you're creating a new commit, then quitting without saving will cancel it. Not so with --amend.

user.description: Ruby/Rails dev, big databases, [No]SQL, cool programming languages, fishing, snowboarding
user.name: James Sadler

text: @mwotton If you :q! on amend, the amend proceeds and you get a new commit with the old message. This is different behaviour to a new commit

text: How to bail on a 'git commit --amend'.  Before exiting your $EDITOR, drop to a terminal and kill the git process that's waiting
